Sections.Title: Field
Sections.Subtitle: Smallest Individual Unit
Sections.Content: The smallest individual unit of data in Elasticsearch. Each field has a defined datatype and contains a single piece of data.

Sections.Title: Analyzer
Sections.Subtitle: Optimize Data For Search
Sections.Content: Allows us to convert unstructured text into a format optimized for search. Analyzers are used during indexing to break down – or parse – phrases and expressions into their constituent terms.

Sections.Title: Document
Sections.Content: Documents are JSON objects that are stored within an index and are considered the base unit of storage. In the world of relational databases, documents can be compared to a row in the table.
Sections.Subtitle: Base Unit Of Storage

Articles.Title: Mapping
Articles.Subtitle: Process of Defining How a Document & Fields are Stored & Indexed
Articles.Footer: Each document is a collection with their own data types.

Sections.Title: Dynamic Mapping
Sections.Subtitle: Adds new fields mapping automatically
Sections.Content: Adds new fields mapping automatically, just by indexing a document. We can add fields to the top-level mapping, to inner object and nested fields.

Sections.Title: Explicit Mapping
Sections.Subtitle: Precisely Choose & Define
Sections.Content: Allows us to precisely choose how to define the mapping definition, such as: Which string fields should be treated as full-text fields. Which fields contain numbers, dates, or geolocations. The format of date values. Custom rules to control the mapping for dynamically added fields.

Articles.Title: Node
Articles.Subtitle: A running instance of elastic search
Articles.Footer: Just like a cluster, a node is identified by a name

Sections.Title: Master Node
Sections.Content: A node that has the master role, which makes it eligible to be elected as the master node, which controls the cluster management and configuration actions such as adding and removing nodes.
Sections.Subtitle: A node that has the master role

Sections.Title: Data Node
Sections.Subtitle: A node that has the data role
Sections.Content: A node that has the data role. Data nodes hold data and perform data-related operations such as CRUD, search, and aggregations. A node with the data role can fill any of the specialized data node roles.

Sections.Title: Ingestion Node
Sections.Subtitle: A node that has the ingest role
Sections.Content: A node that has the ingest role. Ingest nodes are able to apply an ingest pipeline to a document in order to transform and enrich the document before indexing. With a heavy ingest load, it makes sense to use dedicated ingest nodes.

Sections.Title: Coordinator Nodes
Sections.Content: Coordinating only nodes can benefit large clusters by offloading the coordinating node role from data and master-eligible nodes. Adding too many coordinating only nodes to a cluster can increase the burden on the entire cluster.
Sections.Subtitle: Can benefit large clusters

Articles.Title: Index
Articles.Subtitle: A Logical Namespace
Articles.Footer: An index is like a table in a relational database. It is a logical namespace (must be lowercased)

Sections.Title: Hot
Sections.Content: Handles all indexing of new data in the cluster and holds the most recent daily indices that tend to be queried most frequently.
Sections.Subtitle: Frequent Update

Sections.Title: Warm
Sections.Content: Handles a large amount of read-only indices that are not queried frequently. With read-only indices, warm nodes can use very large spindle drives instead of SSD storage.
Sections.Subtitle: No Update

Sections.Title: Cold
Sections.Content: Once data is no longer being updated, it can move from the warm tier to the cold tier where it stays while being queried infrequently. The cold tier is still a responsive query tier, but data in the cold tier is not normally updated.
Sections.Subtitle: Infrequent Queries

Sections.Title: Frozen
Sections.Content: Once data is no longer being queried, or being queried rarely, it may move from the cold tier to the frozen tier where it stays for the rest of its life.
Sections.Subtitle: Rarely Queries
